page.title: 09The Vicar Of Tideswell
page.content: The vicar,The Revd.John.Slyfield succeeded the Rev.J.B.Warburton in 1982.Mr.Slyfield was born in Cheam in Surrey in February 1932.Before being ordained he was a mechanical engineer.Mr Slyfield had wanted to be a priest since the age of twelve. Before coming to Tideswell John Slyfield was a vicar at South Shields. Mr.Slyfield confesses to being nervous before a service.He has a number of helpers on whom he can call for assistance;some retired clergy, a Lay Reader and a Lay Assistant.Mr.Slyfield works from 7.30 am till 11.30 pm.He conducts five services a week.He is responsible for five other churches. Much of his work involves visiting and helping individuals, together with study and the preparation of sermons. He once conducted a funeral and then drove one of the funeral cars.
